Overview.Summary: The 2015 Italian presidential election was held on February 1 and the newly elected president is Sergio Mattarella (1). The election also saw the re-election of President Goodluck Jonathan and his vice Namadi Sambo (2). The Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) released the list of all presidential candidates on January 13 (4). There were concerns about the accuracy of the polls (5). There were also protests against the delay of the February 14 election (6). Live updates were dedicated to the coverage of the results of the election (7). There were also reports of American firms working on both sides of the election (8). President Jonathan released a statement after the results were announced (9).

Timeline.Text: President Goodluck Jonathan announces Namadi Sambo as his running mate for the 2015 presidential election.
Accuracy measures are used to predict the outcome of the 2015 Italian presidential election.
INEC publishes the names of all presidential and vice-presidential candidates for the 2015 election.
The movie 'An Italian Name' is released, depicting the lives of an Italian couple waiting for a baby during the presidential election.
Sicilian judge Sergio Mattarella is elected as the President of Italy, known for his fight against organized crime.
Protests erupt in Nigeria over the postponement of the February 14 presidential election.
Two American firms, who are political allies, are found working for opposite sides in the Nigerian presidential election.
Live updates are provided for the results of the Nigerian presidential and National Assembly elections.
Cost-saving measures at TETFund are used as a lesson for the 2015 Presidential Election.
President Goodluck Jonathan releases a statement after the announcement of the results of the presidential election.

Overview.Summary: The Italian presidential election of 2015 began in parliament (1) after former president Giorgio Napolitano resigned (1). The Independent National Electoral Commission released the names of candidates for the election (4) and the new president, Mattarella, promised to fight crime and corruption (6). The election was also significant because it marked the defeat of longtime president Maithripala Sirisena in Sri Lanka (8). The election was delayed for years and sparked protests (10).

Timeline.Text: Russian President Vladimir Putin delivers his annual Presidential Address to the Federal Assembly.
Haiti's President Michel Martelly sets the date for the 2015 presidential election after years of delays and months of protests.
Helanka TV releases a commercial for the 2015 Sri Lankan presidential election.
The Independent National Electoral Commission releases the names of the candidates for the 2015 presidential election in Nigeria.
Calendariando.it shares a calendar for 2015, including the dates for the Italian presidential election.
Sri Lanka's longtime President Mahinda Rajapaksa is ousted in the presidential election by Maithripala Sirisena.
Vanguard News reports on the upcoming presidential debates in the United States.
The Italian parliament begins the first round of voting to elect the new president, following the resignation of Giorgio Napolitano.
New Italian President Sergio Mattarella vows to fight corruption and organized crime in his inaugural speech to parliament.
The 2015 presidential election in Haiti takes place.

Overview.Summary: The 2015 Italian presidential election saw Sergio Mattarella being elected as the new president of Italy (1, 5, 10). The election was held on January 31, 2015 (1, 10) and saw a high turnout of 74.50% (2). Mattarella, a senior judge and veteran center-left politician, vowed to fight corruption and organized crime (5, 10). The election was closely followed by the ongoing negotiation talks for a possible settlement in Cyprus (3). The results were announced by the Independent National Electoral Commission (6, 8). Mattarella's victory was seen as a political win for Prime Minister Matteo Renzi (10).

Timeline.Text: Sri Lanka holds its presidential election, with Mahinda Percy RAJAPAKSA winning 57.88% of the vote.

Overview.Summary: Ferdinando Imposimato was a name mentioned in the 2015 Italian presidential election (1). The election occurred on January 31, 2015 and featured four rounds of voting (1). The election was also mentioned on December 10, 2014 (2), and was won by Sergio Mattarella, who vowed to fight against the mafia and corruption (8). Other elections mentioned in the articles include the 2016 US presidential election (6) and the 2015 Sri Lankan presidential election (9). Additionally, the 2015 Greek election resulted in a victory for Syriza (10).

Timeline.Text: Ferdinando Imposimato is mentioned as a potential candidate for the 2015 Italian presidential election.
Muhammadu Buhari wins the APC presidential ticket, setting up a race against incumbent President Goodluck Jonathan.
Survey respondents list the most important election issues for the upcoming 2015 United Kingdom general election.
Nigeria's Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) releases the names of candidates in the 2015 presidential election, including incumbent President Goodluck Jonathan.
Sri Lankan President Mahinda Rajapaksa suffers a narrow defeat in the country's presidential election.
Syriza wins the Greek legislative election with a comfortable margin, marking a major shift in the country's political landscape.
Sergio Mattarella is sworn in as the new Italian President, vowing to fight against organized crime.
Ted Cruz announces his bid for the 2016 United States presidential election.
The official results of the 2015 Nigerian presidential election are announced, declaring incumbent President Goodluck Jonathan as the winner.
The fourth round of voting for the 2015 Italian presidential election takes place, with many blank ballots and a few notable names, including Ferdinando Imposimato.

Overview.Summary: Sergio Mattarella, a 73-year old, was elected as the Italian president in the 2015 election (1). The second ballot of the election was unpredictable and had a lot of suspense (1). The inaction of the Italian Parliament regarding civil unions was brought up by the European Court of Human Rights (2). The 2015 Economic Report of the President reviews the United States' recovery and economic issues impacting middle-class families (5). There were concerns about post-election violence in Nigeria, as seen in the 2011 presidential contest (4). In the 2015 parliamentary election in the U.K., forecasts were published by a group of U.K. academics (6). The 2015 presidential election in Nigeria recorded mixed outcomes (10).

Timeline.Text: Sergio Mattarella, 73, is elected as the new Italian president.
The Italian Carnevale of 2015 is celebrated.
The 69th-annual Economic Report of the President is released, exploring the recovery of the United States and its impact on middle-class families.
The conduct of the 2015 presidential and national assembly elections in Nigeria are recorded with mixed outcomes.
Voters in Nigeria come out in droves to cast their ballots in the presidential election.
The opposition candidate, Muhammadu Buhari, is declared the winner of the Nigerian presidential election.
The European Court of Human Rights issues a ruling on the inaction of the Italian parliament regarding civil unions.

Overview.Summary: The 2015 Italian presidential election resulted in the election of Sicilian judge Sergio Mattarella as the new president (1,5). This came after the resignation of former president Giorgio Napolitano (4,7,8). The election was seen as a boost for Prime Minister Matteo Renzi (5), and was followed by the election of Nigeria's General Muhammadu Buhari as president (3,6,10). Other notable elections during this time included the first female president of Croatia, Kolinda Grabar-Kitarovic (9).

Overview.Summary: The third ballot of the 2015 Italian presidential election took place on January 31 (1). Sergio Mattarella was elected as the new president (1). The previous election for the office of president in Sri Lanka was held on January 26, 2010 (3). Opposition candidate Muhammadu Buhari was leading President Goodluck Jonathan in Nigeria's presidential election on March 30 (8). The Commonwealth Secretary-General constituted an Observer Group for the January 8, 2015 presidential election in Sri Lanka (9). The 2015 general election was expected to be vastly improved (10).

Overview.Summary: In 2015, Sergio Mattarella was sworn in as the new Italian president, following the resignation of Giorgio Napolitano (1,6). The Italian presidential election was also overshadowed by the FIFA presidential race (2). Donald Trump won the 2016 presidential election in the United States (3). In Nigeria, opposition candidate Muhammadu Buhari was leading incumbent President Goodluck Jonathan in the election (5). The Italian presidential election was conducted through a secret ballot among lawmakers and regional delegates (8). In Croatia, Kolinda Grabar-Kitarovic became the first female president, winning by a narrow margin (9).

Timeline.Text: The Commonwealth Secretary-General establishes an Observer Group for the upcoming 2015 Italian presidential election.
Kolinda Grabar-Kitarovic becomes the first female president of Croatia, winning by a narrow margin.
Italy's 89-year-old president Giorgio Napolitano steps down after almost nine years in office.
The FIFA presidential race, with Sepp Blatter at the helm, is underway.
Voting begins for the new Italian president.
Sergio Mattarella is sworn in as the new Italian president.
There is speculation that Jonathan Goodluck will not lose the 2015 Nigerian presidential elections.
Opposition candidate Muhammadu Buhari leads in the Nigerian presidential elections.
Jonathan Goodluck is declared the winner of the Nigerian presidential election.
Donald Trump is elected the 45th president of the United States, defeating Hillary Clinton.

Overview.Summary: Sergio Mattarella was elected as the new president of Italy in 2015 (1, 4, 8). He is a former judge and politician with a background in the Christian Democratic party (1, 3, 9). He has a strong stance against the mafia, as his brother was murdered by them (5, 6). In 2015, he visited the ESA headquarters in France (2). He has also taken legal action against Banca d'Italia and the Italian State (10).

Timeline.Text: Sergio Mattarella is elected as the new president of the Italian Republic.
Sergio Mattarella is officially sworn in as the Italian president.
Sergio Mattarella's political background is discussed, from his early involvement with the Christian Democracy party to his current position as a social democrat.
Sergio Mattarella takes legal action against the Bank of Italy and the Italian State in order to recover the value of an old government bond.
In an exclusive interview, Sergio Mattarella discusses the recent murder of Italians in Tunisia and the story of his own brother's murder by the Mafia.
Sergio Mattarella attends the inauguration of the International Book Fair in Turin.
Sergio Mattarella visits the European Space Agency headquarters during an official visit to France.
The name of Sergio Mattarella is suggested as a potential candidate for the Quirinale Palace.

Overview.Summary: Sergio Mattarella was elected as the new President of Italy on January 31, 2015 (1, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10). He had previously served as a constitutional court judge and had a background in the Christian Democratic Party (1, 4, 6). His appointment was seen as a political victory for Prime Minister Matteo Renzi (5). Mattarella's brother was murdered by the Mafia and he has been vocal about his stance against organized crime (15, 16, 17). He has also taken legal action against the Italian government in order to recover the value of an old public bond (19). Mattarella's presidency began in February 2015 and he has since participated in various events and interviews (2, 12, 13, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18, 19, 20).

Timeline.Text: Sergio Mattarella's name is rumored to be a possible candidate for the Italian presidential election.
The first round of voting to elect Italy's new president takes place in Parliament.
Sergio Mattarella is elected as Italy's new president.
Sergio Mattarella's election as president is seen as a political victory for Prime Minister Matteo Renzi.
Sergio Mattarella is sworn in as the new Italian president.
Sergio Mattarella files a lawsuit against Banca d'Italia and the State to recover the value of an old public bond.
A Commonwealth Observer Group is constituted to observe the 2015 Sri Lanka presidential election.
Christiane Amanpour conducts an exclusive interview with President Sergio Mattarella about the murder of Italians in Tunisia.
Sergio Mattarella attends the inauguration of the Salone internazionale del Libro in Turin.
Italy's presidential election takes place, with Sergio Mattarella as one of the candidates.
